intro: Psychotria granulata, commonly known as the granular psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dark green, slightly hairy leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria granulata is also noted for its chemical composition, containing various alkaloids that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
